name: Крепидот мягкий - Crepidotus mollis
comment:
Crepidotus mollis, also known as Soft Crepidotus, is a species of mushroom in the family Crepidotaceae. It is a small, inconspicuous mushroom with a cap that ranges from 0.5 to 2.5 cm in diameter. The cap is smooth, convex to flattened, and typically white to grayish in color. The gills are adnate to sinuate and have a white to pale gray color.

This species is widely distributed and can be found in temperate and tropical regions around the world, growing on decaying wood or plant litter. It is an important decomposer in forest ecosystems, playing a vital role in breaking down organic matter and recycling nutrients.

Crepidotus mollis has been found to contain polysaccharides with immunomodulatory effects, making it a potential candidate for medicinal use. Studies have shown that these polysaccharides have anti-inflammatory and anti-tumor properties, as well as the ability to boost the immune system.

The spores of Crepidotus mollis are elliptical to oblong in shape, with dimensions of 4-6 x 2-3 µm. They are smooth and hyaline, and have a germ pore at one end. The spore print is white.

In summary, Crepidotus mollis is a small but ecologically important mushroom with potential medicinal properties. Its ability to break down organic matter and recycle nutrients make it a valuable contributor to forest ecosystems, while its polysaccharides offer promise in the field of medicine.
title: Crepidotus mollis - Крепидот мягкий - Soft Crepidotus - Weicher Schwindling
